Package propra.imageconverter.io

Class ImageReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • java.io.BufferedInputStream
          • propra.imageconverter.io.ImageReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProPraReader, TGAReader
    public abstract class ImageReader
extends java.io.BufferedInputStream
    Abstract wrapper-class for Image readers.

    • Field Detail

      • dataSegmentSize

        private long dataSegmentSize
        Number of bytes in data segment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageReader

        public ImageReader​(java.io.InputStream in)
        Creates an ImageReader and saves its argument, the input stream in, for later use. An internal buffer array is created and stored in buf.
        Parameters:
        in - the underlying input stream.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataSegmentSize

        public long getDataSegmentSize()
        Returns data segment size.
        Returns:
        dataSegementSize.

      • incrementDataSegmentSize

        public void incrementDataSegmentSize​(long increment)
        Increments dataSegmentSize by given increment.
        Parameters:
        increment - number of bytes to be added to dataSegmentSize.

      • readHeader

        public ImageHeader readHeader()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              InvalidImageException
        Returns header for specific image file.
        Returns:
        image file header.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        InvalidImageException - if imageHeader is invalid, or file is smaller than the header.

      • readRow

        public Pixel[] readRow​(ImageHeader header,
                       Checksum checksum)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       InvalidImageException
        Reads a row of pixels from the input file in uncompressed or rle compressed format and converts it into an array of Pixels. Checksum gets only updated for ProPra images.
        Parameters:
        header - image file header.
        checksum - checksum to get updated.
        Returns:
        pixel that represent the currently read row.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this input stream has been closed by invoking its BufferedInputStream.close() method, or an I/O error occurs.
        InvalidImageException - if the tree is incomplete (the file does not contain a full huffman tree.

      • readUncompressedRow

        private Pixel[] readUncompressedRow​(ImageHeader header,
                                    Checksum checksum)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an umcompressed Row from the input file and converts it into an array of Pixels. Checksum gets only updated for ProPra images.
        Parameters:
        header - image file header.
        checksum - checksum to get updated.
        Returns:
        pixel that represent the currently read row.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this input stream has been closed by invoking its BufferedInputStream.close() method, or an I/O error occurs.

      • readRLERow

        private Pixel[] readRLERow​(ImageHeader header,
                           Checksum checksum)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a run-length encoded Row from the input file and converts it into an array of Pixels. Checksum gets only updated for ProPra images.
        Parameters:
        header - header from input file.
        checksum - checksum to get updated.
        Returns:
        array of pixel representing the currently read row
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this input stream has been closed by invoking its BufferedInputStream.close() method, or an I/O error occurs.

        protected abstract ImageHeader parseHeader​(byte[] header)
                                    throws InvalidImageException
        Parses read bytes into the corresponding fields of the image header
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        created header from read bytes
        Throws:
